right.value: The balance of the pit in Finneys (contract balance minus fees).
The current rescue record holder. All hail!
The number of times that people have been rescued from the pit (aka the number of times people made a profit).

The multipliers applied to all deposits: the final multiplier is a random number between the multpliers shown divided by 100. By default x1.1~x1.5 (up to x2 if rescue tokens are used, granting +0.1 per token). It determines the amount of money you will get when rescued (a saviour share might be deducted).
The fee percentage applied to all deposits. It can change to speed payouts (max 10%).
The amount of Finneys (Ethers * 1000) that need to be deposited for the next payout to be executed.
The amount of Ethers obtained through fees that have not yet been collected by the owner.
The number of times that people have jumped into the pit.
The number of unique users that have joined the pit.
The number of people waiting to be saved.
Entry info: user address, name, expected payout in Finneys (approximate), rescue tokens used.
The id of the user, represents the order in which he first joined the pit.
The number of Rescue Tokens the user has. Tokens are awarded when your deposits save people, and used automatically on your next deposit. They provide a 0.1 multiplier increase per token. (+0.5 max)
The number of times the user has rescued someone from the pit.
The combined earnings of all users in Finney.
